titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Charles Freese, Judgment
CWG8577

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Office of the County Judge of the Franklin County Sct.
Commonwealth
vs } Warrant for peddling without License
Chs. Freese
Copy of Judgment"

Upon hearing of the within Complaint It being duly proven before me that the defendant Chs. Freeze is guilty of the charge of peddling without License, and the sum of One Hundred Dollars being the amount of the fine for Said offence, it is now adjudged by the court that the said Freese shall pay the said fine of One Hundred Dollars together with dollars and cents costs-

A copy attest
Witness -- J. Swigert presiding Judge of Franklin Cty:
The within fine is remitted upon statement of Comths Atty & others
W, H, Sneed County attorney Franklin Co
